organization.fullName: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Urinary Kallidinogenase in the Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke Combined With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Urinary Kallidinogenase in the Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke Combined With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (TK-SEEK): a Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-parallel Controlled Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

leadSponsor.name: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo parallel control study, aim to evaluate the efficacy and safety of human urinary kallidinogenase in the treatment of acute ischemic stroke with type 2 diabetes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The study process lasts for a total of 90 days, including the screening period, intervention period, and follow-up period. During the intervention period, the experimental group is treated with Urinary Kallidinogenase, while the control group is treated with placebo for 10 days. Both groups receive routine clinical treatment. All patients are followed up until the 90th day after stroke. The sample size of the study is 630 patients. The ratio of the experimental group to the control group is 1:1.

armGroups.label: Urinary Kallidinogenase for injection
armGroups.description: Patients in this arm will be given urinary kallidinogenase for injection, 0.15 peptide nucleic acids(PNA), once a day for 10 days

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: An inactive substance identical in appearance to the urinary kallidinogenase for injection, once a day for 10 days

interventions.name: Urinary Kallidinogenase for injection
interventions.description: The 0.15 peptide nucleic acids(PNA) unit of Eurecrine for injection was dissolved in 100ml sodium chloride injection by intravenous infusion for not less than 50 minutes, once a day. The solvent can be increased and/or slowed down according to the patient's condition for 10 consecutive days, while receiving clinical routine treatment for 10 days

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: The 0.15 peptide nucleic acids(PNA) unit of placebo was dissolved in 100ml sodium chloride injection by intravenous infusion for not less than 50 minutes, once a day. The solvent can be increased and/or slowed down according to the patient's condition for 10 consecutive days, while receiving clinical routine treatment for 10 days.

primaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of patients with modified rankin scale (mRS) 0-2 scores at 90±7 days
primaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of patients with modified rankin scale (mRS) 0-2 scores at 90±7 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of patients with modified rankin scale (mRS) 0-3 scores at 90±7 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of patients with modified rankin scale (mRS) 0-3 scores at 90±7 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Distribution of modified rankin scale (mRS) at 90±7 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes of NIHSS from baseline to 10 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes of Barthel index from baseline to 90±7 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes of Barthel index from baseline to 90±7 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes of mini-mental state examination (MMSE) from baseline to 90±7 days

secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes of Montreal cognitive assessment (MoCA) from baseline to 90±7 days

otherOutcomes.measure: Changes of fasting blood glucose values from baseline to 10 days
otherOutcomes.description: Changes of fasting blood glucose values from baseline to 10 days

otherOutcomes.measure: Changes of HBA1c from baseline to 90±7 days
otherOutcomes.description: Changes of HBA1c from baseline to 90±7 days

otherOutcomes.measure: Changes of hypersensitive C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) and interleukin-6 (IL-6)
otherOutcomes.description: Changes of hypersensitive C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) and interleukin-6 (IL-6)

otherOutcomes.description: Changes of urea nitrogen, creatinine and urinary protein

otherOutcomes.measure: Incidence, severity, and causality of adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE) during the intervention
